website_summaries.verdict: Though it's a sturdy tool for most jobs, it's not as versatile as others we considered.
pros: The combination of its ergonomic build and dependable, 1.25 hp motor make it a contender with higher-priced models
cons: 27,000 rpm speed is fixed, making it awkward for jobs that require less power
Owners of older Porter-Cable models say it lacks the quality of previous generations

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router but...
customer_reviews.text: Lacks a guide. No guide available anywhere or any sort of case. Routers need a case big enough to hold bits and wrangle the cord. Nothing here but the cardboard box that it came with.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Everett

customer_reviews.title: Top heavy and prone to chatter.
customer_reviews.text: This machine has a very small base for as tall as it is. the result very top heavy router that is very prone to causeing chatter and difficult to glide smoothly. I replaced the base and it works great now however
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: Very well-made, Powerful small router.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-made tool with a powerful motor and a cleanly made base. Competing tools from other brands have crudely cast parts. The look and feel cheap. This tool is tight and well finished. The motor is powerful enough to do the job for which it is intended. If you are looking for a small router, spend a few extra dollars and get this tool. It will last and do a good job for you.
customer_reviews.author: GregV

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I'm a contractor & designer, Porter Cable is my choice , and I have about dozen or so...ranging from the trim routers to the 3 1/2 HP plunge units. This was a new design, I was purchasing several 7310 3/4 Trim routers, and ordered one of these to give it a try... I like the size... though I still have use for my 1 1/2 HP s and the D handle 1 3/4 HP's models , I think I'll get a few more of these as they are very handy in the shop.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Ragland

customer_reviews.title: can't tell if it's broken
customer_reviews.text: No clue what happened, it was working fine the first few mins but now it just acts crazy and shakes so much like the bit wants to come out or something. I thought it was loose, so i tighten it but still kept going crazy. If i can get help on this ill gladly change my review to 5 stars but for now im just going to assume its broken.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R.

customer_reviews.title: Well designed router
customer_reviews.text: We use many of these routers in our shop. They hold up very well. Easy to adjust on the fly. We actually replace brushes because they wear out with the amount of use these get. We have not had any other repairs on these routers yet.
customer_reviews.author: jerryb

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice name brand. Makes a sawdust mess :-). Wish i bought the set that includs the plunge base.
customer_reviews.author: Donald L Caton

customer_reviews.title: Best compact router ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny! Compact and super easy to use. Not heavy at all.
customer_reviews.author: schubert santos

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy it to use.. but could have been lower in price
customer_reviews.author: Frampton

customer_reviews.title: Needs a case.
customer_reviews.text: Great little router four making special touches on a job site. This is my second one. Someone else decided they really liked my first one and took it. I just wish I had a case for it.
customer_reviews.author: Always Avid

customer_reviews.title: This PORTER-CABLE Router is compact and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: long time since I used a router in shop class and this is a great one. feels light in my hand and plenty of power for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J.

customer_reviews.title: Great little trim router!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little trim router. I bought it for milling out 80% lowers, works great! Used with the Easy Jig Gen 2. Go slow and mill one hash mark at a time. It eats right through 7075 aluminum!
customer_reviews.author: Peter C

customer_reviews.title: Compact Router
customer_reviews.text: This is one awesome tool!! Small, light weight, and very powerful!!
customer_reviews.author: Cricketchuck

customer_reviews.title: not as good as there old style
customer_reviews.text: its ok, not as good as there old style, hard to adjust and does not glide as easy as the old ones with the black plastic bottom
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Pleased as pie
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect marriage between the 1.5 horse standard size and the smaller trim routers. It is smaller in size but with the full circumference base housing leaving no chance for flexing or varying depth which has been a problem with the half circumference base housings of the small trim routers.It also has the proper base plate for the template collar rings for doing door and jamb dapping.
customer_reviews.author: Got Wood

customer_reviews.title: Real Router at a great price
customer_reviews.text: This is a real router. I have had some other brands and they are less than expected. This Porter Cable however is the best...
customer_reviews.author: Eric Tavitian

customer_reviews.title: The router is the perfect size for me
customer_reviews.text: The router is the perfect size for me. I make a lot of wooden signs and the weight of the router makes it ideal for me. I own five other routers and i use this one more than the others.
customer_reviews.author: Donald H. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Nice router.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I needed. Wish I had got the handles and collar also as it gets hot using it for milling aluminum and holding it around the body.
customer_reviews.author: Mantracker

customer_reviews.title: I love this router
customer_reviews.text: I love this router. Had a model 64 that I used (free hand signs) for over twenty years and finally failed with no parts available. So I bought this one and made a sleeve out of PVC pipe to fit my old base. Works great!.
customer_reviews.author: Shell Surgeon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Milling 80% lowers
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I bought it for Works awesome for finishing 80% lowers
customer_reviews.author: R. Santos

customer_reviews.title: Great little router
customer_reviews.text: Needed a smaller router for laminate edge trimming. Also ran into need where in a tight space my standard size Porter-Cable router with its diameter would not fit. This smaller router did the job. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: George T. Workman

customer_reviews.title: Porter-Cable does it all
customer_reviews.text: Great little router for the money. Easy to hold with one hand and ample power for laminate and woodworking. The height and bit adjustment are great, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great router, not as good as the discontinued 3102 router by Porter Cable
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel P Gilliam

customer_reviews.title: It worked great. I've been buying tools for many years and ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my renovation project to mortise the door jamb for hinges. It worked great. I've been buying tools for many years and have always had good luck with Porter Cable products.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Great procuct. be sure to tighten the grip adjustment
customer_reviews.text: Great procuct. be sure to tighten the grip adjustment, the router will walk deeper on you.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Donahoe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good router just a bit noisy for this size.
customer_reviews.author: Fred.B

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work so good milling aluminum.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for milling a 80 percent lower. Got the job done but I would look for something else if you plan on doing a few of them.
customer_reviews.author: Barndog

customer_reviews.title: Compact Router
customer_reviews.text: Also ordered this for my husband, it was a good price, it came on time, and the packaging was good, He said it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Clora Fotis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: great! Help with several projects we were working on. Great value
customer_reviews.author: TJK

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job without being bulky like my full sized router. Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hockman

customer_reviews.title: Great compact router
customer_reviews.text: Very well made compact router. Smooth starting and smooth running.
customer_reviews.author: dredneb

customer_reviews.title: Nice little router
customer_reviews.text: I'm a sub contractor, and bought this to mortise door hinges and latch and strikes on new blank doors. Works well, is light, powerful, gets the job done quick and neatly. If this one got lost or stolen, I would buy the same router again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: plenty of power, the table could be a bit larger, but I'll fix that. I have small hands and I find it comfortable. Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Michael F. Jasmin

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great little router so far
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great little router so far. Easy to hold and drive around edges. My only recommended improvements is some type of built in dust collection, and ability to hold 1/2" router bits since that is the bulk of my collection.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Hart

customer_reviews.title: it is good for a shop
customer_reviews.text: we are using it in a shop in a 8 hour shift 5 day a week and it is a good router
customer_reviews.author: tata gg

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Thing burned out the lower bearing in about 5 days of use. I wont be buying another!
customer_reviews.author: Karl Marullo

customer_reviews.title: Good as it gets for palm routers in the $100 ...
customer_reviews.text: Good as it gets for palm routers in the $100 range. Good power. Works best to remove the best to change bits. Thats why it only gets 4 starts. Its a bit of a pain in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: Insider Carpentry

customer_reviews.title: Very nice router
customer_reviews.text: This router is just right for smaller jobs and more powerful than laminate routers in those tight spots. Great Router
customer_reviews.author: Greg Reith

customer_reviews.title: This isn't the droid your looking for. Move along.
customer_reviews.text: I've had so many drill bits fall out even after cranking down and keeping it tight. It's ruined a couple of expensive projects of mine by dropping drill bits at high speed and dinging the crap out of my projects.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Product came broken
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband, he needed new routers for work. It arrived and never worked at all. Unfortunately I had wrapped it as a gift and my 30 day window was over to return it. DON'T but this product it is total garbage. Still sitting new in packaging, as a reminder to buy from my local store instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Ervin

customer_reviews.title: The Goldilocks of Routers?
customer_reviews.text: Not quite sure what they were going for with this one. Felt too big to be a trim router but too small to be a full size machine. We sent it back and will stick with the ful size Bosch router and the assortment of trim routers we use now.
customer_reviews.author: Doug B.

product_meta.title: PORTER-CABLE Router, Compact, 1.25 HP (450)
product_meta.description: Style:RouterErgonomically designed to allow for comfortable and assured, single handed control . Durable 1.25HP motor delivers the power to meet the toughest applications. Soft-starting motor features full-time electronic feedback that maintains motor speed through the cut. Adjustment ring enables controlled bit depth changes to within 1/64". Depth ring and clamping mechanism combine to ensure motor remains locked in position. Large, low-pressure spindle lock button allows for comfortable, single wrench bit changes.
feature_bullets: Ergonomically designed to allow for comfortable and assured, single handed control
Durable 1.25HP motor delivers the power to meet the toughest applications, Fixed speed, 27,000 rpm
Soft-starting motor features full-time electronic feedback that maintains motor speed through the cut
Adjustment ring enables controlled bit depth changes to within 1/64-inch
Depth ring and clamping mechanism combine to ensure motor remains locked in position

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars115 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
